articles.description: Shrapnel Studio Head Don Norbury tells Kate Irwin the reasons why the upcoming first-person shooter game will offer a wide range of NFTs. He also reveals team-based gameplay plans and shares how game maps have already changed this year.
articles.title: Blockchain Is 'Only Way' Forward for Gaming, Says Shrapnel Studio Head

articles.description: Sacha Ghebali, Director of Strategy and Business Development at The TIE, says social media sentiment remains a key factor in price movements for major cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum. However, he notes that sentiment has turned more negative lately amid regulatory uncertainty. Ghebali believes events like the Ripple lawsuit ruling significantly impacted sentiment and prices. André Beganski interviewed him at Messari Mainnet.
articles.title: Social Media Sentiment Is Key to Crypto Price Discovery

articles.author: Reza Jafery
articles.description: Our host Reza Jafery is joined by Gareth Fenney aka 500Altcoins. They discuss the glory days of DeFi Summer and whether or not its a smart move for builders in the crypto space to relocate to Dubai.
articles.title: 500Altcoins discusses DeFi Summer and the Dubai Crypto Scene - This Time Will Be Different - Episode 2

articles.description: David Gogel of dYdX discusses how the decentralized exchange is building a custom blockchain to fully decentralize derivatives trading. He explained how the new dYdX chain will allow validators to run order books in memory, enabling decentralized order matching at scale. This shift aims to increase security and transparency for traders while maintaining the performance of centralized exchanges.
articles.title: Decentralize Derivatives Trading with Custom Blockchain

articles.description: Decrypt's Stacy Elliott sat down with Ledger CEO Pascal Gauthier to discuss crypto custody post-FTX, and the hardware wallet manufacturer's controversial Ledger Recover service.
articles.title: Most Crypto Users Don't Trust Themselves to Keep Their Seed Phrase Safe: Ledger CEO

articles.description: As crypto matures, accounting and tax regulations are evolving. Amy Kalnoki of Bitwave explains how her company helps crypto companies properly account for digital assets. She notes the importance of flexibility as new crypto assets emerge and regulations change. Stacy Elliott interviewed her at Messari Mainnet 2023.
articles.title: Crypto Accounting Challenges and Opportunities

articles.description: As India figures out its regulatory approach to the crypto industry, one thing is clear to Shardeum co-founder Nischal Shetty: “If you're a high-frequency trader, you can't afford to lose a percentage every time you sell,” he told Decrypt's Andre Beganski at Messari Mainnet in New York. “That's something that's caused a lot of issues.”
articles.title: India's 1% Crypto Tax Has Been a Nightmare for High-Frequency Traders, Says Shardeum CEO

articles.description: Solana has improved network reliability through upgrades like Quick and local fee markets. It recently partnered with Visa to allow settling transactions in USDC on Solana. This could enable merchants to receive instant payments and save on credit card processing fees. Stacy Elliott spoke with Austin Federa, Head of Strategy for the Solana Foundation, at Messari Mainnet 2023.
articles.title: Newly Partnered with Visa, Solana Focuses on Reliability

articles.description: Decrypt's Stacy Elliott sat down with Robinhood Crypto general manager Johann Kerbrat at Messari Mainnet 2023, to talk about the trading platform's crypto wallet, onboarding new users through simplicity, and keeping platform fees sustainable.
articles.title: We Need to Start Thinking About How we Make Crypto Easy to Use: Robinhood Crypto General Manager

articles.description: Rich Rines, original Core DAO contributor and former Coinbase engineer, discusses how the narrative around Bitcoin is shifting in 2023. While Bitcoin remains digital gold, new layer 2 solutions are emerging to unlock more utility and value from the huge amounts of capital stored in Bitcoin. He says these innovations can benefit Bitcoin holders while keeping Bitcoin maximalists happy by building outside the base layer. André Beganski interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.
articles.title: Bitcoin's Narrative Is Shifting Towards Layer-2 Solutions

articles.description: Dave Weisberger, Co-Founder and CEO of CoinRoutes, argued that excessive regulation in the U.S. threatens to undermine the country's long-standing dominance in global financial markets. He warned that other countries are embracing blockchain and crypto to build more efficient digital markets, which could cause the US to lose its competitive edge and trillions in GDP. Weisberger said CoinRoutes is now focusing more on expanding internationally due to restrictive policies in the U.S. He was interviewed by André Beganski of Decrypt at Messari Mainnet 2023.
articles.title: Regulation Threatens U.S. Dominance of Financial Markets, Says CoinRoutes CEO

articles.description: Daniel Helm, head of Developer Relations at Scroll, discussess how they are building a zkRollup to scale Ethereum transactions and lower fees. He explained their focus on creating a seamless developer experience by maintaining Ethereum's ethos and tooling. Scroll aims to launch their mainnet soon, providing more scalable blockspace for Ethereum developers. Stacy Elliott of Decrypt interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.
articles.title: Building a Developer-Friendly zkRollup to Scale Ethereum

articles.description: Paul Brody drives Ernst & Young (EY) initiatives and investments in blockchain technology across consulting, audit, and tax business lines. He says enterprise blockchain adoption is nearing an inflection point. Brody believes blockchains will one day handle 40 billion transactions daily across industries like automotive and pharma. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.
articles.title: Explosive Growth Ahead for Enterprise Blockchain

articles.description: Coinbase's Jesse Pollak, creator of layer-2 blockchain Base, says the launch of the network has exceeded expectations, even if plans changed along the way. He believes Arbitrum One will help bring billions onto blockchain by enabling seamless user experiences. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.
articles.title: Base as a 'Bridge, Not an Island'

articles.description: Jack O'Holleran is CEO and co-founder of SKALE Labs. He explains how on-chain gaming is ready for the mainstream after overcoming early challenges like high fees and poor user experience. Companies can now build blockchain games that look and feel like traditional games, and scalability improvements allow games to support hundreds of millions of players without performance issues. He was interviewed by André Beganski at Messari Mainnet 2023.
articles.title: On-Chain Gaming Poised for Mass Adoption

articles.description: Billy Sebell of the XDC Foundation discussed the proliferation of new layer-1 and layer-2 blockchain solutions. While this expands possibilities, he noted projects must still attract users amidst growing competition. Sebell highlighted the benefits of targeting niche use cases and bringing real-world assets on-chain via tokenization. He was interviewed by André Beganski of Decrypt at Messari Mainnet 2023.
articles.title: New Blockchains Boom Creates Opportunity and Challenges

articles.description: Dave Lemke is the CFO & CCO at Giddy, creators of a crypto wallet with decentralized private key security. He explains how their solution allows self-custody while still being recoverable. He highlighted increasing demand for self-custody after the FTX collapse. Lemke also touched on upcoming US crypto regulations and Getty's roadmap to simplify staking and other complex processes. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.
articles.title: Accessible Self-Custody for Crypto

articles.author: Bitcoin Magazine
articles.description:
In the heart of Manhattan, high above Hudson Yards in a bustling hotel, Bitcoin Magazine’s Editor in Chief, Mark Goodwin, sat down with US presidential hopeful Robert F. Kennedy Jr. for a candid and engaging interview that shed new light on his political vision.
The interview commenced with RFK's assessment of the Democratic Party and the evolving definition of a "Kennedy Democrat." According to him, Kennedy Democrats are rooted in the party's historical values of advocating for the working class, environmental stewardship, anti-war principles, and skepticism towards corporate influence. He emphasized the need to counter the undue influence of financial giants like BlackRock, State Street, and Vanguard, which control a significant portion of the economy, including military contractors, agr…
articles.title: The Robert F. Kennedy Jr. Interview: Bitcoin, CBDCs & The War on Freedom

articles.author: Scott Matherson
articles.description:
An anonymous crypto investor and crypto enthusiast “Shibtoshi” who became a billionaire with Shiba Inu (SHIB) back in 2021, has revealed how he did it in an interview with Youtuber, Bad Anthony.
 
Shiba Inu Investor On The Greatest Investment Of All Time
 
In the interview with crypto Youtuber Bad Anthony, the crypto investor “Shitoshi” revealed how he made one of the greatest trades of all time, if not the greatest. 
 
According to the crypto investor, he first gained interest in Shiba Inu during the early days of Shiba Inu back in August 2020. He revealed that he had invested $8,000 in the SHIB back in August 2020, when the token began trading. The token had been brought to his attention by his friends who apparently also invested in it.
 
The crypto investor confirmed that he became int…
articles.title: Crypto Investor Reveals How He Became A Billionaire With Shiba Inu

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description:
Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF), the disgraced co-founder of the now insolvent cryptocurrency exchange FTX, concluded his first day of trial involving jury selection and voir dire questioning. The process extended into Wednesday as U.S. District Judge Lewis Kaplan eliminated several potential jurors on Tuesday.
 
Trial of FTX Co-Founder SBF Unveils Juror Crypto Losses on Day One of Voir Dire
 
A day earlier, on Tuesday, Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF) appeared in the courtroom sporting a considerably shorter haircut and accompanied by his legal counsel. Various media outlets reported on the jury selection and voir dire, including an extensive X thread from Matthew Russell Lee’s Inner City Press publication. Judge Kaplan and the court aim to select a total of 12 jurors and approximately six alternates, hop…
articles.title: Crypto Tycoon SBF in the Dock: Jury Selection Extended; Hearing Reveals Financial Carnage

articles.author: Matt Leisinger
articles.description: Alluvial co-founder Matt Leisinger argues Ethereum staking would be an obvious beneficiary of a product like ARK Invest's Ethereum-based exchange-traded fund going to market.
articles.title: A Spot ETH ETF Represents the Dawn of Institutional Liquid Staking

articles.author: Jared Kirui
articles.description:
Judge Lewis Kaplan, the presiding judge in Sam  
Bankman-Fried’s case, has unveiled a panel of 12 jurors and six alternates who  
will be sworn in, marking the beginning of a trial that has garnered  
significant attention. 
The U.S. Prosecutors have filed multiple charges of fraud  
and conspiracy against Bankman-Fried following the collapse of his  
crypto-trading platform, FTX. Prosecutors allege that the 31-year-old  
entrepreneur misappropriated approximately $8 billion in customer funds. These  
funds were purportedly used to cover high-risk bets made by his crypto hedge  
fund, acquire luxury real estate in the Bahamas, and make substantial  
contributions to U.S. political campaigns.
Sam Bankman-Fried's Legal Showdown
A jury of twelve New York judges, including a physician's  
assi…
articles.title: Sam Bankman-Fried's Trial Commences with 12-Judge Jury Selection

articles.author: Christian Encila
articles.description:
Shiba Inu (SHIB) enthusiasts have long harbored a fervent aspiration: to see the meme coin achieve the elusive one-cent mark. While the current SHIB price, standing at $0.00000726 according to CoinGecko, might seem far away from this dream, the community remains steadfast in its hope.
 
A quick glance at the recent price trends reveals SHIB’s uphill battle. Over the last 24 hours, the token has experienced a minor decline of 0.4%, despite a modest seven-day price gain of 0.6%. The question looms large: how can SHIB traverse the monumental gap between its current value and the coveted one-cent milestone?
 
 
To reach $0.01, SHIB would need an astronomical surge. The exponential price increase required underscores the enormous challenge ahead. The community’s determination to achieve this re…
articles.title: Shiba Inu: Two Hidden Catalysts That Could Catapult SHIB To $0.01

articles.author: Nikhilesh De
articles.description: "He poured money — other people's money — into investments to make himself even richer," the prosecutor said in opening arguments.
articles.title: Sam Bankman-Fried 'Lied,' DOJ Tells Jury; Defense Tries to Pin FTX Collapse on Caroline Ellison

articles.author: Bradley Keoun
articles.description: In this week’s issue of The Protocol, we highlight layoffs hitting key firms as well, and how blockchain projects are competing for new mandates – specifically big Ethereum layer-2 developers like OP Labs, Polygon and Matter Labs vying to provide the technology for the Celo blockchain’s new network
articles.title: The Protocol: Which Ethereum Layer-2 Project ISN’T Competing to Land Celo?

articles.author: Kent Glory
articles.description:
The United Kingdom’s Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) is about to launch its second crypto sandbox, which comprises set rules to govern digital securities. According to the FCA’s head of capital markets, Helen Boyd, the UK Treasury will release the Digital Securities Sandbox in Q1 of 2024.
 
This development comes about two months after the FCA permanently rolled out the UK’s first Digital Sandbox on August 1. The first sandbox comprised data sets and insights designed to foster innovation and growth and encourage international competitiveness for tech startups.
 
UK Treasuries Introduces Sandbox To Encourage Digital Securities Adoption 
 
During the CCData Digital Asset Summit on October 3, Helen Boyd announced that the Royal Treasury will launch the new sandbox by the end of the first q…
articles.title: Why UK’s FCA Plans To Launch Another Digital Securities Sandbox

articles.author: Ben Schiller
articles.description: If your defense is “I didn’t know what was happening,” don’t dress like a competent person.
articles.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Shouldn’t Have Cut His Hair

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description:
The Department of Justice (DOJ) has asked the judge in Sam Bankman-Fried’s (SBF) criminal case to restrict several planned defense arguments about financial regulations. Prosecutors said in a new court filing that SBF should not be allowed to claim he’s innocent because cryptocurrency exchanges faced little regulation. They also argued he can’t use his compliance with U.S. laws as proof of good faith.
 
Prosecutors Seek to Limit SBF’s Defense Arguments About Regulations
 
In the Wednesday letter, federal prosecutors asked U.S. District Judge Lewis Kaplan to reconsider or clarify a recent order limiting trial evidence. They aim to block Sam Bankman-Fried (SBF) from arguing that FTX’s lack of U.S. oversight made his actions legal. Prosecutors called the alleged claim “inaccurate” and “highly…
articles.title: DOJ Clamps Down on SBF’s Regulatory Loophole Defense Amid Ongoing Fraud Trial

articles.author: Media
articles.description:
Understanding volatility in the crypto market
 
The world of cryptocurrencies is known for its volatility, with prices fluctuating wildly within short periods. For traders, the ability to navigate and even capitalize on this is crucial to success. Understanding volatility in the crypto market is the first step to mastering it. Volatility refers to the rapid and significant price movements that cryptocurrencies experience. These price fluctuations can be caused by various factors, such as market sentiment, regulatory changes, economic events, or even social media trends.
 
To become a successful crypto trader, one must develop resilience in the face of volatility. Resilience is the ability to adapt and recover quickly from market fluctuations. It involves strategies and tools that enable tr…
articles.title: Bitfinex’s Role in Taming Crypto Market Volatility: Resilience at Its Core

articles.author: Scott Matherson
articles.description:
Amid crypto prices being on a tear this week, with Bitcoin crossing above $28,000 in the early hours of Monday, the XRP price has done particularly well, rising over $0.54 in the past 24 hours. 
 
Apart from the overall market strength, some factors have contributed to XRP’s current strength, ranging from easing legal troubles to Ripple getting a new money license in Asia. 
 
Ripple Updates Push XRP Price Surge
 
XRP price has witnessed sustained buying pressure this week as positive news swirls around the Ripple ecosystem to increase confidence from buyers. For one, Ripple’s legal issues seem to be easing as the payments technology company recently scored another win in court. 
 
 
On October 3, federal Judge Analisa Torres dismissed the SEC’s interlocutory appeal motion against the rulin…
articles.title: XRP Price Surges To $0.54, Here’s Why

articles.author: Eliman Dambell
articles.description:
Polygon surged to its strongest level since the end of August, as the token extended recent gains. The rally comes despite cryptocurrencies mostly consolidating on Wednesday, following recent declines. XRP was another notable gainer today.
 
Polygon (MATIC)
 
Polygon (MATIC) rose for a back-to-back session on Wednesday, hitting a multi-week high in the process.
 
MATIC/USD moved to an intraday high of $0.5937 in today’s session, which comes following a low of $0.5523 the day before.
 
This resulted in polygon climbing to its highest point since August 29, when the price peaked at $0.6355.
 
 
Looking at the chart, the surge saw the relative strength index (RSI) rise past a ceiling at the 62.00 zone.
 
Currently, the index is now at a reading of 62.76, with an upcoming resistance level at the 70.00 point.
 
A crossover between the 10-day (red) and 25-day (blue) moving averages also seems to be one of the reasons for today’s rally.
 
 
XRP
 
XRP was another big mover on Wednesday, as the price attempted to break out of a key resistance level.
 
After Tuesday’s low at $0.5075, XRP/USD rallied to an intraday high of $0.5449 during today’s session.
 
As a result of this surge, the world’s fifth-largest cryptocurrency briefly rose past a ceiling at $0.5400.
 
 
Earlier gains have since edged lower, which comes as the RSI fell below a ceiling at the 62.00 mark.
 
The index has since dropped further, and is now tracking at 56.57, and seems to be heading towards a floor of 51.00.
 
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
 
Will XRP plunge further as the session progresses? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.
articles.title: Biggest Movers: MATIC Moves to Highest Point Since August

articles.author: Jared Kirui
articles.description:
A substantial amount of $4.1 billion worth of FTT tokens was 
moved between FTX and Alameda Research before the cryptocurrency exchange 
collapsed. As former FTX's CEO Sam Bankman-Fried faces a series of charges linked 
to the exchange's downfall, a recent report by Nansen has revealed questionable 
transactions involving FTX and its hedge fund, Alameda Research. 
It all began with the discovery that Alameda held a 
significant share of 40% of its assets, worth $14.6 billion in the form of FTT 
tokens, in September 2022. But Nansen's analysts had their suspicions even 
before these reports surfaced.   
Between September 28 and November 1, $4.1 billion worth of 
FTT tokens were transferred from Alameda to FTX, along with a number of 
significant transfers of United States dollar-pegged stab…
articles.title: FTX and Alameda's Secret Dealings: $4.1B in FTT Tokens Transferred before Bankruptcy

articles.author: Jake Simmons
articles.description:
The Shiba Inu cryptocurrency community is currently on high alert due to the compromise of a prominent admin’s Telegram account. Ragnar Shib, an esteemed administrator in the Shiba Inu ecosystem, recently had his Telegram handle hijacked. The compromised account was used to falsely announce an illegitimate BONE token airdrop.
 
The scam attempted to push a sense of urgency amongst SHIB enthusiasts by stating that the supposed airdrop had a limited supply. The message from the fraudsters read:
 
“The BONE community airdrop wave is now open for claiming. A moment a lot of you have been waiting for! We appreciate the increase in interest and engagement up to this point in Shib’s journey. Holders, followers and builders are all eligible to claim a select amount of BONE, more information below.…
articles.title: Shiba Inu Telegram Admin Account Compromised: Community On Alert
